metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4559 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
lighttpd before 1.4.33 does not check the return value of the (1) setuid, (2) setgid, or (3) setgroups functions, which might cause lighttpd to run as root if it is restarted and allows remote attackers to gain privileges, as demonstrated by multiple calls to the clone function that cause setuid to fail when the user process limit is reached.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-cml - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-magnet - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-mysql-vhost - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2').
